meanings.definition: To excuse oneself from a case or situation due to a conflict of interest.
meanings.sent1: She recuses herself from the decision because she knows one of the parties involved.
meanings.sent2: The judge recuses himself from the trial to maintain fairness.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer recuses herself from the case after realizing her brother is the defendant.
meanings.sent4: The conflict of interest was so clear that she had no choice but to recuse herself.
meanings.sent5: Recusing oneself from a case is a crucial step in upholding justice.

meanings.definition: To disqualify oneself from participating in a legal proceeding.
meanings.sent1: He recuses himself from the lawsuit to avoid any bias.
meanings.sent2: The attorney recuses herself from the trial to maintain impartiality.
meanings.sent3: The judge recuses himself from the case to go on vacation.
meanings.sent4: Recusing himself from the legal proceeding, he watched from the sidelines.
meanings.sent5: The decision to recuse oneself can impact the outcome of the trial.

meanings.definition: To withdraw from a position of authority or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: She recuses herself from the leadership role to focus on her health.
meanings.sent2: The CEO recuses himself from the company due to a scandal.
meanings.sent3: The manager recuses herself from the project to give others a chance.
meanings.sent4: Recusing himself from the position, he felt a sense of relief.
meanings.sent5: The act of recusing oneself can lead to new opportunities for growth.
